data.title: While debugging, no clear UI indication of module I'm in...

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:  1.12.2
- OS Version:  Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Launch some complex Node.js application under the debugger
2.  Press the pause button to break in "unfamiliar territory"

Problem:

Source code displayed is often "unattributed".   There is no obvious hint as to know what module I'm in.   

Suggestion:

Change the default `window.title` setting to ` "window.title" to use `${activeEditorLong}` so the newcomer won't have to learn all about settings when they are trying to debug. e.g.:
```
    "window.title": "${dirty}${activeEditorLong}${separator}${rootName}${separator}${appName}",
 
```

data.title: code-completion doesn't use next suggestion on pressing tab multiple times
data.body:
**TL;DR** the <kbd>tab</kbd> key should insert first suggestion, but then cycle through suggestions, replacing the last completion.

Sublime autocompletion can be configured so that when pressing the <kbd>tab</kbd> multiple times it will cycle through the autocompletions by inserting the first suggestion (closing the suggestion box), then replacing the suggestion by succeeding ones when pressing <kbd>tab</kbd> repeatedly.

Problem description: 
Visually:
```
// e.g. 1. typing`whatI` will render both options in suggestion box
whatI|
      -whatIGet   // => 2. first option will be autocompleted on `tab` closing the suggestion box
      -whatIWant // => 3. on second `tab` this should replace the first (wrong) suggestion

function whatIWant() {}

funciton whatIGet() {}
``` 

Textually:
1. Type whatI
2. Suggestions will pop up
3. Wrong suggestion is highlighted
4. <kbd>tab</kbd> to complete wrong suggestion
5. Suggestions-popup disappears
6. Still at the end of inserted suggestion press <kbd>tab</kbd> again
7. Wrong suggestion should be replaced by next suggestion in list

Currently the corresponding controllers don't seem to support this, as accepting the current suggestion to my understanding will clear the suggestion list.

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/3215f19074d49e32d5ab55203923865910d4d5ca/src/vs/editor/contrib/suggest/browser/suggestController.ts
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/794b435b27bcf4a92cc0a6345b97821e3c827dcc/src/vs/editor/contrib/suggest/browser/suggestWidget.ts

How are people getting around having to press arrow-down and arrow-up :man_facepalming:? I somehow never get the correct suggestion at the top and I quite frankly don't have the most flexible pinky 😢

data.title: Suggestion: CodeLens provider & shared context to improve performance.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Version 1.12.1 (1.12.1)
- OS Version: Windows 64 bits

This issue is not a bug but just a suggestion/idea to improve CodeLens performance for TypeScript when `references `and `implementation ``CodeLens `are activated.  In this case tsserver command `navtree` which can take times and response can be big is called twice:

 * one call of navtree for providing references CodeLens.
 * one call of navtree for providing implementation CodeLens.

I tell me if CodeLens provider could manage a shared context to store some data that other code lens provider could use it. For instance in this case, we could have just one call of navtree:

* one call of navtree for providing references CodeLens and store the result in a shared context.
 * the implementation CodeLens provider search navtree from the shared context.

data.title: resourceScheme context does not work in in menu.commandPalette contribution
Restrict markdown preview to markdown files
data.body:
**Problem**
You can currently use the markdown preview command with any file type. This can result in odd looking previews when you preview a code file. When you open the markdown preview for other file types, we also do not support live updates of the preview

**Proposal**
Limit the `Open Markdown Preview` commands to markdown files

data.title: Native web selection is possible in editor when dragging from terminal or tab well
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Mouse down in tab well
2. Drag cursor down to terminal

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/26903006-608cb4d0-4b90-11e7-86a2-3acf4a7cd916.png)

This causes issues for the new terminal selection model https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/9958. This is an issue for the old/current terminal selection too but since you can't drag scroll the viewport it's less noticeable. Could we add `user-select: none` to the editor?

data.title: `npm run watch` high CPU usage on macOS
data.body: Steps to Reproduce: 1. Run `npm run watch` in the vscode repo on macOS. 2. Wait for everything to finish `Finished compilation with 0 errors after 58528 ms` 3. Look at your CPU usage in activity monitor Expected: Minimal CPU usage Actual: gulp consistently consuming 40% of one core. I did some brief research and found quite a few threads relating to gulp and watching files. Here are some of the more interesting ones: - https://github.com/gulpjs/gulp/issues/1805 - https://www.martin-brennan.com/gulp-watch-high-cpu-usage/

data.title: Git markers won't be removed properly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (c8123b036b66ca6e319bae00bfd7c34bb1ad977b, 2017-06-06T21:31:11.642Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.4.2|
|gitlens|eamodio|3.6.1|
|LogFileHighlighter|emilast|1.1.1|
|vscode-reveal|evilz|0.0.9|
|php-intellisense|felixfbecker|1.2.2|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.4.2|
|smarty|imperez|0.2.0|
|vscode-apache|mrmlnc|1.1.1|
|php-docblocker|neilbrayfield|1.2.0|
|vscode-versionlens|pflannery|0.18.1|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.9.0|
|vscode-todo-highlight|wayou|0.5.5|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.8.5|;

**In this steps, I disabled any extension to report it properly.**


---

Steps to Reproduce:

**First of all, you need to define a keybinding of your choice to push changes.**

1. Make a file change: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11234139/26902516-dad4bdb6-4bd9-11e7-9115-85834e3028f7.png)
2. See the marker recognizes the change
3. Go to the git panel.
4. Write a commit message.
5. Use a shortcut to increase productivity: Hit `Ctrl+Enter` and **immediately** your keybinding (I use `Ctrl+Shift+H`).
6. See the loading badge comes up in the sidebar
7. After the loading badge disappeared, you still see the git marker:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11234139/26902658-5f884b72-4bda-11e7-928d-02422c67546a.png)
8. Close the editor
9. Open the editor again
10. You see the git markers are gone.

Hello,

when 1.13 version will be released? It says early June in your Wiki, but it seems it will be at the mid of June?

data.title: Update protocol document for CompletionItemKind and SymbolKind?
data.body:
The C/C++ extension has been following the protocol here to define our protocol messages (the bulk of our extension is written in C++) https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/blob/master/protocol.md

I stumbled on this thread #2628 and saw commits that looked like they changed the enum values of CompletionItemKind and SymbolKind.  So it appears that we are sending incorrect values back to VS Code now.

I just wanted to double-check... are the enum values in VS Code now different than the ones in the protocol?

data.title: Emmet html abbreviations should be suggested inside <style> or <script> blocks
data.body:
Set `emmet.useNewEmmet` to `true

In an html file, create a `style`/`script` tag.
Anything you type inside gets treated as an html abbreviation to expand.

since this abbreviation is suggested at the very top, users will always have to navigate the list for their actual preferred completion item

data.title: In Javascript switch/case, when typing ":", enter triggers autocomplete instead of new line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Win 10 64 bit

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Create an HTML file with a script tag
2. Create an empty switch statement
3. Type a case & semicolon
4. When pressing enter to get to the next line, autocomplete triggers instead of new line

In my case, **$** was auto completed instead of creating a new line.

**Sample Code:**
```<!doctype html>
<html lang="en-us" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
	<meta charset="utf-8" />
	<title>CTS | Matrix Energy Services</title>
	<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.1.1/jquery.js"></script>

	<style>
		x-condensor-title {
			font-weight: bold;
		}
	</style>
</head>
<body>
	<script>
		// var $ from JQuery (from above include) was my top-most recommendation
		switch (element.tagName) {
			case "x-condensor-summary":$
		}
	</script>
</body>
</html>
```

data.title: Multithreaded in Insiders does not show callstack for threads other than the one that has stopped.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 
Version 1.13.0-insider
Commit f977399d58f7b64db35047fafe0c6e59e15f11d5
Date 2017-06-02T10:54:04.063Z
Shell 1.6.6
Renderer 56.0.2924.87
Node 7.4.0
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create C++ multithreaded app.
2. Set breakpoint where there will be multiple threads
3. start debugging
4. try and expand other threads to get info

Expected:
Each thread is expandable and shows callstack

Actual:
No thread beyond the one that stopped is getting a callstack

When looking at the VSdebug protocol logging, i'm showing only one call to `stackTrace` only on the thread that is stopped at. When expanding the others, I expect to get a stack trace call for the thread expanded which i'm not.

I tried this with VSCode Stable 1.12.2 and it works as expected so I think this is a regression in Insiders, possibly due to fixing the multithreaded issue.
